result.execSummary:
The defendant Emily Rose Harper-Hellie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Hennepin County Minnesota if arrangements are made.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation but must petition the Court.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF274.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emily Rose Harper-Hellie

Defendant and Atty signed this date. eif

CO: Judge Richards for Branch IV, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Liddle ,ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Jens Hubert Loberg   DF:  Emily Rose Harper-Hellie appeared. Case called at 9:20 a.m. ADA Bork filed motion to amend information. Requesting court to grant amendment of Misdemeanor Possession of Cocaine. Court so grants amendment of the charge.  ADA Bork gives agreement and recommendations.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Atty Loberg requesting expungement.  DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Misd. Possession of Cocaine in 14CF274 .  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Atty Loberg requesting probation be transferred to the Hennepin County where she resides. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Misdemeanor Possession of Cocaine in 14CF274. Defendant may apply for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  hml Crt orders:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report today. May serve Probation in Hennepin Co if arrangements are made
- Court costs of $243.00
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
to amend Criminal Information w/draft of Amended Information filed by ADA Amber Hahn. eif

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jens Hubert Loberg   DF:  Emily Rose Harper-Hellie appeared.  Court called at 11:25 a.m.  Attorney Loberg advises the court he is still waiting for all the toxicology reports to come back.  ADA Hahn verifies the issues with the toxicology reports.  Court will set for plea/sentencing unless toxicology reports do not come back in time for the next hearing then it will be a STC.  Court will allow Attorney Loberg and the DE to appear by phone if plea/sentencing becomes a STC.  Court adjourned at 11:30 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Loberg does not have the toxicology report back as of yet.  Continue PTC.  Bond continues in form and amount. CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Jens Hubert Loberg   DF: Emily Rose Harper-Hellie appeared.  Court called at 2:35 p.m.  S/T of Officer Edward Rankin of the Hudson Police Department.  Direct by ADA Sortedahl.  DE is identified by Officer Rankin.  Cross by Attorney Loberg.  Witness excused.  Court finds probable cause and binds the DE over for trial.  State files an Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands.  DE enters a plea of NG.  Court sets for a PTC.  Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at 2:51 p.m.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
